newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan money rates up on excess liquidity.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan money rates up on excess liquidity.

text.p: Pakistan's inter-bank money market rates opened higher on news of a special open market operation by the central bank but fell near close as excess liquidity was left in the system, dealers said.
The overnight funding rates opened at 12 percent and soon shot up to 15 percent in anticipation of a large sum being drained out in the market operation, one dealer said.
But the rates fell and were traded at four percent near close as news spread that the central bank had mopped up only 700 million rupees, much lower than expected, the dealer said.
